author: Marty Brockman
comment: Single Device Only.  Purchased on Phone wants me to purchase again for tablet.  Ordered Onkyo App but all it controls is my TIVO. Worked fine before I purchased Pro App. Also to many versions of this app to tell which One actually should be used.  And any developer that does not offer refund after finding app lacks function Not cool. Avoid

reply.author: Pocketwood
reply.content: If you sign in with the same account on both devices then you don't have to buy MyAV twice. Both versions should control your Onkyo and your Tivo, but you may have to change the search settings. Also, some Onkyo models can only handle one device connected at a time.

author: Steve Burbrink
comment: Unlike the official Onkyo version, this works and works well!

author: Juan Insignares
comment: I downloaded the application off rip it asked me to upgrade didn't even give me a chance to use it I have an old receiver I'll kill my last phone worked on it now on my new Galaxy 8 I can't figure it out an application for it

author: Unknown Unknown
comment: I was looking for such app for many days. Thanks a lot. And I own a 10 years old Onkyo AV receiver. This app is working perfectly fine with it.

author: David Gagnon
comment: Worked really well with my TX-NR616, my Onkyo was automatically detect over the wifi from my Samsung Galaxy S8.
Awesome Universal Remote

author: Kev
comment: No good, no support for my system

reply.author: Pocketwood
reply.content: What makes and models of devices do you have?

author: Harinitha Balasubramanian
comment: Top class remote.

author: Gilbert G
comment: It said specific used for onkio, when you want to add a onkio reciver it gives u two options Denon or technics! ! How would you ad an onkio?

reply.author: Pocketwood
reply.content: Add an "AVR" and you should see "Onkyo"

author: Roy Tulio
comment: I purchased this app and it's better than anything in the market

author: Jesse Strahn
comment: Much, MUCH better than the Onkyo app in terms of usability. I do agree with other reviewers that have said the ui could be polished. As it is, I'll take function over form.

author: Shweta Bhiwapurkar
comment: Pathetic ui...

author: Rich Kyanka
comment: Uh the app appears to work with my Panasonic / Onkyo, but dear lord it's UI looks like a failed junior high Visual Basic project from the 90s. My phone feels dirty while using it. With a cleaner, more concise UI, this app could be great. But as it looks right now, I feel trapped in somebody's schizophrenic nightmare of obscene oval abominations.
title: The world's worst functional UI

author: Johan Bernhardsson
comment: The app is so ugly I have to uninstall. Doesn't matter that it seems to be better than Onkyo remote. It almost gave me a headache!
title: Works but please please please create a better ui

author: Robert Greenhouse
comment: All the functions of my Onkyo receiver at the ready and on my phone! But now I have a galaxy S7 edge with no ir and I have found settings I didn't know I had on my tx-nr609 like 4K! Thanks for a great app. How do I cycle through the speakers on the test signal?

reply.author: Pocketwood
reply.content:
Thanks for the good review. 
With your GS5 you can also control other devices using the built-in IR blaster. Just go to the settings cog and hit "add IR device". Most brands of TV are in there and we are going to add more IR codes in the future.

title: No easier

author: paul hanscomb
comment: Wow what can I say full 5* this is so much better than onkyo own app this works so well,  highly recommended,  easy to use everything in front of me smooth,  cant fault it look forward to updates any chance adding zgemma H2s box with full epg be cool
title: Onkyo 818 AV

author: Mark Bowering
comment: Installed on Samsung Note 2 and crashes instantly.  This is the first time in being a 6 year android user that an app has behaved like this.
title: Instantly crashes

author: Andrew Stroup
comment: I decided to use this for a few hours while my Logitech harmony remote was charging with my onkyo receiver. the program listed wierd inputs like 'phono' and 'tape 1' and 'tape 2', as if they existed within the past 15 years, but didn't have my most used input on my receiver, 'PC', so the app became pretty useless fast. I understand inputs in the app can be removed, but none can be added. none of the inputs in the app would go to 'HDMI 1' which is the PC input on my Onkyo.

reply.author: Pocketwood
reply.content: Which model of receiver do you have, as we do have HDMI1 and PC available on certain models? For Wi-Fi control We preset the inputs based on the info on the Onkyo website. If you were using IR then we could add these, but generally most people who are using IR have older non-networked receivers.

author: Damian Maurice
comment: This is mad cool..now I can use my remote in the dark,something ONKYO should have done.Back light your remotes
title: ONKYO REMOTE

comment: I have an Onkyo Amplifier.  Installed on Note3 and it crashes. Useless App...  Back to the drawing board 😢
title: Does Not work.

comment: Only problem is, how do you pay for the full version?

comment: Great app.  starting using with NR616. Works good. Selecting input source & selecting type of audio are very easy.

reply.content: Which model of Onkyo receiver do you have?

reply.author: Pocketwood
reply.content: Please can you email support info@myav.co.uk and we will try to solve the problem.

author: Hector Estarellas
comment: Super accurate

author: Josh Wenthold
comment: App works great for onkyo receiver, needs support for att uverse cable boxes....update, built in dlna control is super laggy using the app.  Works great directly on the receiver, but the app wont control the receiver dlna controls directly

reply.author: Pocketwood
reply.content: We are working to support AT&T Uverse over Wi-Fi, we have added support for Uverse using IR.

title: Needs Uverse support

author: Glen Browne
comment: I was really hoping this would find my txnr609 but it only picks up my txnr636 like the official onkyo apps do, the 609 dropped off a few months ago presumably after an app "upgrade". Sigh. This app though has some additional sound options and is a reasonable first effort. Could be prettier perhaps

reply.author: Pocketwood
reply.content: MyAV should work with both.Have you tried switching to room profile 2, as it could be that the 636 is assigned to room profile 1? Please email us info@myav.co.uk for more support.

title: Picks up one reciever but not the other

author: Mike Jackson
comment: I love the Dolby Atmos logo.

reply.author: Pocketwood
reply.content: Thanks for the good review. We had to get a copy of a Atmos Blu-Ray to test it out properly,

title: Works Awesome.

comment: Very nice app. Thank you.
